intro: Papaver dubium subsp. modestum, commonly known as the modest poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces striking, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
